intro: Microstylis boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin Islands microstylis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and grass-like foliage. It thrives in moist, coastal environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
